2273 - 'center': Center the base on the *x* positions. 

2274 - 'edge': Align the left edges of the bars with the *x* positions. 

2275 

2276 To align the bars on the right edge pass a negative *width* and 

2277 ``align='edge'``. 

2278 

2279 Returns 

2280 ------- 

2281 `.BarContainer` 

2282 Container with all the bars and optionally errorbars. 

2283 

2284 Other Parameters 

2285 ---------------- 

2286 color : color or list of color, optional 

2287 The colors of the bar faces. 

2288 

2289 edgecolor : color or list of color, optional 

2290 The colors of the bar edges. 

2291 

2292 linewidth : float or array-like, optional 

2293 Width of the bar edge(s). If 0, don't draw edges. 

2294 

2295 tick_label : str or list of str, optional 

2296 The tick labels of the bars. 

2297 Default: None (Use default numeric labels.) 

2298 

2299 label : str or list of str, optional 

2300 A single label is attached to the resulting `.BarContainer` as a 

2301 label for the whole dataset. 

2302 If a list is provided, it must be the same length as *x* and 

2303 labels the individual bars. Repeated labels are not de-duplicated 

2304 and will cause repeated label entries, so this is best used when 

2305 bars also differ in style (e.g., by passing a list to *color*.) 

2306 

2307 xerr, yerr : float or array-like of shape(N,) or shape(2, N), optional 

2308 If not *None*, add horizontal / vertical errorbars to the bar tips. 

2309 The values are +/- sizes relative to the data: 

2310 

2311 - scalar: symmetric +/- values for all bars 

2312 - shape(N,): symmetric +/- values for each bar 

2313 - shape(2, N): Separate - and + values for each bar. First row 

2314 contains the lower errors, the second row contains the upper 

2315 errors. 

2316 - *None*: No errorbar. (Default) 

2317 

2318 See :doc:`/gallery/statistics/errorbar_features` for an example on 

2319 the usage of *xerr* and *yerr*. 

2320 

2321 ecolor : color or list of color, default: 'black' 

2322 The line color of the errorbars. 

2323 

2324 capsize : float, default: :rc:`errorbar.capsize` 

2325 The length of the error bar caps in points. 

2326 

2327 error_kw : dict, optional 

2328 Dictionary of keyword arguments to be passed to the 

2329 `~.Axes.errorbar` method. Values of *ecolor* or *capsize* defined 

2330 here take precedence over the independent keyword arguments. 

2331 

2332 log : bool, default: False 

2333 If *True*, set the y-axis to be log scale. 

2334 

2335 data : indexable object, optional 

2336 DATA_PARAMETER_PLACEHOLDER 

2337 

2338 **kwargs : `.Rectangle` properties 

2339 

2340 %(Rectangle:kwdoc)s 

2341 

2342 See Also 

2343 -------- 

2344 barh : Plot a horizontal bar plot. 

2345 

2346 Notes 

2347 ----- 

2348 Stacked bars can be achieved by passing individual *bottom* values per 

2349 bar. See :doc:`/gallery/lines_bars_and_markers/bar_stacked`. 

2350 """ 

2351 kwargs = cbook.normalize_kwargs(kwargs, mpatches.Patch) 

2352 color = kwargs.pop('color', None) 

2353 if color is None: 

2354 color = self._get_patches_for_fill.get_next_color() 

2355 edgecolor = kwargs.pop('edgecolor', None) 

2356 linewidth = kwargs.pop('linewidth', None) 

2357 hatch = kwargs.pop('hatch', None) 

2358 

2359 # Because xerr and yerr will be passed to errorbar, most dimension 

2360 # checking and processing will be left to the errorbar method. 

2361 xerr = kwargs.pop('xerr', None) 

2362 yerr = kwargs.pop('yerr', None) 

2363 error_kw = kwargs.pop('error_kw', {}) 

2364 ezorder = error_kw.pop('zorder', None) 

2365 if ezorder is None: 2365 ↛ 2371line 2365 didn't jump to line 2371, because the condition on line 2365 was never false

2366 ezorder = kwargs.get('zorder', None) 

2367 if ezorder is not None: 

2368 # If using the bar zorder, increment slightly to make sure 

2369 # errorbars are drawn on top of bars 

2370 ezorder += 0.01 

2371 error_kw.setdefault('zorder', ezorder) 

2372 ecolor = kwargs.pop('ecolor', 'k') 

2373 capsize = kwargs.pop('capsize', mpl.rcParams["errorbar.capsize"]) 

2374 error_kw.setdefault('ecolor', ecolor) 

2375 error_kw.setdefault('capsize', capsize) 

2376 

2377 # The keyword argument *orientation* is used by barh() to defer all 

2378 # logic and drawing to bar(). It is considered internal and is 

2379 # intentionally not mentioned in the docstring. 

2380 orientation = kwargs.pop('orientation', 'vertical') 

2381 _api.check_in_list(['vertical', 'horizontal'], orientation=orientation) 

2382 log = kwargs.pop('log', False) 

2383 label = kwargs.pop('label', '') 

2384 tick_labels = kwargs.pop('tick_label', None) 

2385 

2386 y = bottom # Matches barh call signature. 

2387 if orientation == 'vertical': 

2388 if y is None: 

2389 y = 0 

2390 else: # horizontal 

2391 if x is None: 

2392 x = 0 

2393 

2394 if orientation == 'vertical': 

2395 self._process_unit_info( 

2396 [("x", x), ("y", height)], kwargs, convert=False) 

2397 if log: 

2398 self.set_yscale('log', nonpositive='clip') 

2399 else: # horizontal 

2400 self._process_unit_info( 

2401 [("x", width), ("y", y)], kwargs, convert=False) 

2402 if log: 2402 ↛ 2403line 2402 didn't jump to line 2403, because the condition on line 2402 was never true

2403 self.set_xscale('log', nonpositive='clip') 

2404 

2405 # lets do some conversions now since some types cannot be 

2406 # subtracted uniformly 

2407 if self.xaxis is not None: 2407 ↛ 2413line 2407 didn't jump to line 2413, because the condition on line 2407 was never false

2408 x0 = x 

2409 x = np.asarray(self.convert_xunits(x)) 

2410 width = self._convert_dx(width, x0, x, self.convert_xunits) 

2411 if xerr is not None: 

2412 xerr = self._convert_dx(xerr, x0, x, self.convert_xunits) 

2413 if self.yaxis is not None: 2413 ↛ 2420line 2413 didn't jump to line 2420, because the condition on line 2413 was never false

2414 y0 = y 

2415 y = np.asarray(self.convert_yunits(y)) 

2416 height = self._convert_dx(height, y0, y, self.convert_yunits) 

2417 if yerr is not None: 

2418 yerr = self._convert_dx(yerr, y0, y, self.convert_yunits) 

2419 

2420 x, height, width, y, linewidth, hatch = np.broadcast_arrays( 

2421 # Make args iterable too. 

2422 np.atleast_1d(x), height, width, y, linewidth, hatch) 

2423 

2424 # Now that units have been converted, set the tick locations. 

2425 if orientation == 'vertical': 

2426 tick_label_axis = self.xaxis 

2427 tick_label_position = x 

2428 else: # horizontal 

2429 tick_label_axis = self.yaxis 

2430 tick_label_position = y 

2431 

2432 if not isinstance(label, str) and np.iterable(label): 

2433 bar_container_label = '_nolegend_' 

2434 patch_labels = label 

2435 else: 

2436 bar_container_label = label 

2437 patch_labels = ['_nolegend_'] * len(x) 

2438 if len(patch_labels) != len(x): 

2439 raise ValueError(f'number of labels ({len(patch_labels)}) ' 

2440 f'does not match number of bars ({len(x)}).') 

2441 

2442 linewidth = itertools.cycle(np.atleast_1d(linewidth)) 

2443 hatch = itertools.cycle(np.atleast_1d(hatch)) 

2444 color = itertools.chain(itertools.cycle(mcolors.to_rgba_array(color)), 

2445 # Fallback if color == "none". 

2446 itertools.repeat('none')) 

2447 if edgecolor is None: 

2448 edgecolor = itertools.repeat(None) 

2449 else: 

2450 edgecolor = itertools.chain( 

2451 itertools.cycle(mcolors.to_rgba_array(edgecolor)), 

2452 # Fallback if edgecolor == "none". 

2453 itertools.repeat('none')) 

2454 

2455 # We will now resolve the alignment and really have 

2456 # left, bottom, width, height vectors 

2457 _api.check_in_list(['center', 'edge'], align=align) 

2458 if align == 'center': 

2459 if orientation == 'vertical': 

2460 try: 

2461 left = x - width / 2 

2462 except TypeError as e: 

2463 raise TypeError(f'the dtypes of parameters x ({x.dtype}) ' 

2464 f'and width ({width.dtype}) ' 

2465 f'are incompatible') from e 

2466 bottom = y 

2467 else: # horizontal 

2468 try: 

2469 bottom = y - height / 2 

2470 except TypeError as e: 

2471 raise TypeError(f'the dtypes of parameters y ({y.dtype}) ' 

2472 f'and height ({height.dtype}) ' 

2473 f'are incompatible') from e 

2474 left = x 

2475 else: # edge 

2476 left = x 

2477 bottom = y 

2478 

2479 patches = [] 

2480 args = zip(left, bottom, width, height, color, edgecolor, linewidth, 

2481 hatch, patch_labels) 

2482 for l, b, w, h, c, e, lw, htch, lbl in args: 

2483 r = mpatches.Rectangle( 

2484 xy=(l, b), width=w, height=h, 

2485 facecolor=c, 

2486 edgecolor=e, 

2487 linewidth=lw, 

2488 label=lbl, 

2489 hatch=htch, 

2490 ) 

2491 r._internal_update(kwargs) 

2492 r.get_path()._interpolation_steps = 100 

2493 if orientation == 'vertical': 

2494 r.sticky_edges.y.append(b) 

2495 else: # horizontal 

2496 r.sticky_edges.x.append(l) 

2497 self.add_patch(r) 

2498 patches.append(r) 

2499 

2500 if xerr is not None or yerr is not None: 

2501 if orientation == 'vertical': 

2502 # using list comps rather than arrays to preserve unit info 

2503 ex = [l + 0.5 * w for l, w in zip(left, width)] 

2504 ey = [b + h for b, h in zip(bottom, height)] 

2505 

2506 else: # horizontal 

2507 # using list comps rather than arrays to preserve unit info 

2508 ex = [l + w for l, w in zip(left, width)] 

2509 ey = [b + 0.5 * h for b, h in zip(bottom, height)] 

2510 

2511 error_kw.setdefault("label", '_nolegend_') 

2512 

2513 errorbar = self.errorbar(ex, ey, 

2514 yerr=yerr, xerr=xerr, 

2515 fmt='none', **error_kw) 

2516 else: 

2517 errorbar = None 

2518 

2519 self._request_autoscale_view() 

2520 

2521 if orientation == 'vertical': 

2522 datavalues = height 

2523 else: # horizontal 

2524 datavalues = width 

2525 

2526 bar_container = BarContainer(patches, errorbar, datavalues=datavalues, 

2527 orientation=orientation, 

2528 label=bar_container_label) 

2529 self.add_container(bar_container) 

2530 

2531 if tick_labels is not None: 

2532 tick_labels = np.broadcast_to(tick_labels, len(patches)) 

2533 tick_label_axis.set_ticks(tick_label_position) 

2534 tick_label_axis.set_ticklabels(tick_labels) 

2535 

2536 return bar_container 

2537 

2538 # @_preprocess_data() # let 'bar' do the unpacking.. 

2539 @_docstring.dedent_interpd 

2540 def barh(self, y, width, height=0.8, left=None, *, align="center", 

2541 data=None, **kwargs): 

2542 r""" 

2543 Make a horizontal bar plot. 

2544 

2545 The bars are positioned at *y* with the given *align*\ment. Their 

2546 dimensions are given by *width* and *height*. The horizontal baseline 

2547 is *left* (default 0). 

2548 

2549 Many parameters can take either a single value applying to all bars 

2550 or a sequence of values, one for each bar. 

2551 

2552 Parameters 

2553 ---------- 

2554 y : float or array-like 

2555 The y coordinates of the bars. See also *align* for the 

2556 alignment of the bars to the coordinates. 

2557 

2558 width : float or array-like 

2559 The width(s) of the bars. 

2560 

2561 height : float or array-like, default: 0.8 

2562 The heights of the bars. 

2563 

2564 left : float or array-like, default: 0 

2565 The x coordinates of the left side(s) of the bars. 

2566 

2567 align : {'center', 'edge'}, default: 'center' 

2568 Alignment of the base to the *y* coordinates*: 

2569 

2570 - 'center': Center the bars on the *y* positions. 

2571 - 'edge': Align the bottom edges of the bars with the *y* 

2572 positions. 

2573 

2574 To align the bars on the top edge pass a negative *height* and 

2575 ``align='edge'``. 

2576 

2577 Returns 

2578 ------- 

2579 `.BarContainer` 

2580 Container with all the bars and optionally errorbars. 

2581 

2582 Other Parameters 

2583 ---------------- 

2584 color : color or list of color, optional 

2585 The colors of the bar faces. 

2586 

2587 edgecolor : color or list of color, optional 

2588 The colors of the bar edges. 

2589 

2590 linewidth : float or array-like, optional 

2591 Width of the bar edge(s). If 0, don't draw edges. 

2592 

2593 tick_label : str or list of str, optional 

2594 The tick labels of the bars. 

2595 Default: None (Use default numeric labels.) 

2596 

2597 label : str or list of str, optional 

2598 A single label is attached to the resulting `.BarContainer` as a 

2599 label for the whole dataset. 

2600 If a list is provided, it must be the same length as *y* and 

2601 labels the individual bars. Repeated labels are not de-duplicated 

2602 and will cause repeated label entries, so this is best used when 

2603 bars also differ in style (e.g., by passing a list to *color*.) 

2604 

2605 xerr, yerr : float or array-like of shape(N,) or shape(2, N), optional 

2606 If not *None*, add horizontal / vertical errorbars to the bar tips. 

2607 The values are +/- sizes relative to the data: 

2608 

2609 - scalar: symmetric +/- values for all bars 

2610 - shape(N,): symmetric +/- values for each bar 

2611 - shape(2, N): Separate - and + values for each bar. First row 

2612 contains the lower errors, the second row contains the upper 

2613 errors. 

2614 - *None*: No errorbar. (default) 

2615 

2616 See :doc:`/gallery/statistics/errorbar_features` for an example on 

2617 the usage of *xerr* and *yerr*. 

2618 

2619 ecolor : color or list of color, default: 'black' 

2620 The line color of the errorbars. 

2621 

2622 capsize : float, default: :rc:`errorbar.capsize` 

2623 The length of the error bar caps in points. 

2624 

2625 error_kw : dict, optional 

2626 Dictionary of keyword arguments to be passed to the 

2627 `~.Axes.errorbar` method. Values of *ecolor* or *capsize* defined 

2628 here take precedence over the independent keyword arguments. 

2629 

2630 log : bool, default: False 

2631 If ``True``, set the x-axis to be log scale. 

2632 

2633 data : indexable object, optional 

2634 If given, all parameters also accept a string ``s``, which is 

2635 interpreted as ``data[s]`` (unless this raises an exception). 

2636 

2637 **kwargs : `.Rectangle` properties 

2638 

2639 %(Rectangle:kwdoc)s 

2640 

2641 See Also 

2642 -------- 

2643 bar : Plot a vertical bar plot. 

2644 

2645 Notes 

2646 ----- 

2647 Stacked bars can be achieved by passing individual *left* values per 

2648 bar. See 

2649 :doc:`/gallery/lines_bars_and_markers/horizontal_barchart_distribution`. 

2650 """ 

2651 kwargs.setdefault('orientation', 'horizontal') 

2652 patches = self.bar(x=left, height=height, width=width, bottom=y, 

2653 align=align, data=data, **kwargs) 

2654 return patches 

2655 

2656 def bar_label(self, container, labels=None, *, fmt="%g", label_type="edge", 

2657 padding=0, **kwargs): 

2658 """ 

2659 Label a bar plot. 

2660 

2661 Adds labels to bars in the given `.BarContainer`. 

2662 You may need to adjust the axis limits to fit the labels. 

2663 

2664 Parameters 

2665 ---------- 

2666 container : `.BarContainer` 

2667 Container with all the bars and optionally errorbars, likely 

2668 returned from `.bar` or `.barh`. 

2669 

2670 labels : array-like, optional 

2671 A list of label texts, that should be displayed. If not given, the 

2672 label texts will be the data values formatted with *fmt*. 

2673 

2674 fmt : str or callable, default: '%g' 

2675 An unnamed %-style or {}-style format string for the label or a 

2676 function to call with the value as the first argument. 

2677 When *fmt* is a string and can be interpreted in both formats, 

2678 %-style takes precedence over {}-style. 

2679 

2680 .. versionadded:: 3.7 

2681 Support for {}-style format string and callables. 

2682 

2683 label_type : {'edge', 'center'}, default: 'edge' 

2684 The label type. Possible values: 

2685 

2686 - 'edge': label placed at the end-point of the bar segment, and the 

2687 value displayed will be the position of that end-point. 

2688 - 'center': label placed in the center of the bar segment, and the 

2689 value displayed will be the length of that segment. 

2690 (useful for stacked bars, i.e., 

2691 :doc:`/gallery/lines_bars_and_markers/bar_label_demo`) 

2692 

2693 padding : float, default: 0 

2694 Distance of label from the end of the bar, in points. 

2695 

2696 **kwargs 

2697 Any remaining keyword arguments are passed through to 

2698 `.Axes.annotate`. The alignment parameters ( 

2699 *horizontalalignment* / *ha*, *verticalalignment* / *va*) are 

2700 not supported because the labels are automatically aligned to 

2701 the bars. 

2702 

2703 Returns 

2704 ------- 

2705 list of `.Text` 

2706 A list of `.Text` instances for the labels. 

2707 """ 

2708 for key in ['horizontalalignment', 'ha', 'verticalalignment', 'va']: 

2709 if key in kwargs: 2709 ↛ 2710line 2709 didn't jump to line 2710, because the condition on line 2709 was never true

2710 raise ValueError( 

2711 f"Passing {key!r} to bar_label() is not supported.") 

2712 

2713 a, b = self.yaxis.get_view_interval() 

2714 y_inverted = a > b 

2715 c, d = self.xaxis.get_view_interval() 

2716 x_inverted = c > d 

2717 

2718 # want to know whether to put label on positive or negative direction 

2719 # cannot use np.sign here because it will return 0 if x == 0 

2720 def sign(x): 

2721 return 1 if x >= 0 else -1 

2722 

2723 _api.check_in_list(['edge', 'center'], label_type=label_type) 

2724 

2725 bars = container.patches 

2726 errorbar = container.errorbar 

2727 datavalues = container.datavalues 

2728 orientation = container.orientation 

2729 

2730 if errorbar: 

2731 # check "ErrorbarContainer" for the definition of these elements 

2732 lines = errorbar.lines # attribute of "ErrorbarContainer" (tuple) 

2733 barlinecols = lines[2] # 0: data_line, 1: caplines, 2: barlinecols 

2734 barlinecol = barlinecols[0] # the "LineCollection" of error bars 

2735 errs = barlinecol.get_segments() 

2736 else: 

2737 errs = [] 

2738 

2739 if labels is None: 

2740 labels = [] 

2741 

2742 annotations = [] 

2743 

2744 for bar, err, dat, lbl in itertools.zip_longest( 

2745 bars, errs, datavalues, labels 

2746 ): 

2747 (x0, y0), (x1, y1) = bar.get_bbox().get_points() 

2748 xc, yc = (x0 + x1) / 2, (y0 + y1) / 2 

2749 

2750 if orientation == "vertical": 

2751 extrema = max(y0, y1) if dat >= 0 else min(y0, y1) 

2752 length = abs(y0 - y1) 

2753 else: # horizontal 

2754 extrema = max(x0, x1) if dat >= 0 else min(x0, x1) 

2755 length = abs(x0 - x1) 

2756 

2757 if err is None or np.size(err) == 0: 

2758 endpt = extrema 

2759 elif orientation == "vertical": 2759 ↛ 2762line 2759 didn't jump to line 2762, because the condition on line 2759 was never false

2760 endpt = err[:, 1].max() if dat >= 0 else err[:, 1].min() 

2761 else: # horizontal 

2762 endpt = err[:, 0].max() if dat >= 0 else err[:, 0].min() 

2763 

2764 if label_type == "center": 

2765 value = sign(dat) * length 

2766 else: # edge 

2767 value = extrema 

2768 

2769 if label_type == "center": 

2770 xy = (0.5, 0.5) 

2771 kwargs["xycoords"] = ( 2771 ↛ exitline 2771 didn't jump to the function exit

2772 lambda r, b=bar: 

2773 mtransforms.Bbox.intersection( 

2774 b.get_window_extent(r), b.get_clip_box() 

2775 ) 

2776 ) 

2777 else: # edge 

2778 if orientation == "vertical": 

2779 xy = xc, endpt 

2780 else: # horizontal 

2781 xy = endpt, yc 

2782 

2783 if orientation == "vertical": 

2784 y_direction = -1 if y_inverted else 1 

2785 xytext = 0, y_direction * sign(dat) * padding 

2786 else: # horizontal 

2787 x_direction = -1 if x_inverted else 1 

2788 xytext = x_direction * sign(dat) * padding, 0 

2789 

2790 if label_type == "center": 

2791 ha, va = "center", "center" 

2792 else: # edge 

2793 if orientation == "vertical": 

2794 ha = 'center' 

2795 if y_inverted: 

2796 va = 'top' if dat > 0 else 'bottom' # also handles NaN 

2797 else: 

2798 va = 'top' if dat < 0 else 'bottom' # also handles NaN 

2799 else: # horizontal 

2800 if x_inverted: 

2801 ha = 'right' if dat > 0 else 'left' # also handles NaN 

2802 else: 

2803 ha = 'right' if dat < 0 else 'left' # also handles NaN 

2804 va = 'center' 

2805 

2806 if np.isnan(dat): 

2807 lbl = '' 

2808 

2809 if lbl is None: 

2810 if isinstance(fmt, str): 

2811 lbl = cbook._auto_format_str(fmt, value) 

2812 elif callable(fmt): 

2813 lbl = fmt(value) 

2814 else: 

2815 raise TypeError("fmt must be a str or callable") 

2816 annotation = self.annotate(lbl, 

2817 xy, xytext, textcoords="offset points", 

2818 ha=ha, va=va, **kwargs) 

2819 annotations.append(annotation) 

2820 

2821 return annotations 

2822 

2823 @_preprocess_data() 

2824 @_docstring.dedent_interpd 

2825 def broken_barh(self, xranges, yrange, **kwargs): 

2826 """ 

2827 Plot a horizontal sequence of rectangles. 

2828 

2829 A rectangle is drawn for each element of *xranges*. All rectangles 

2830 have the same vertical position and size defined by *yrange*. 

2831 

2832 Parameters 

2833 ---------- 

2834 xranges : sequence of tuples (*xmin*, *xwidth*) 

2835 The x-positions and extends of the rectangles. For each tuple 

2836 (*xmin*, *xwidth*) a rectangle is drawn from *xmin* to *xmin* + 

2837 *xwidth*. 

2838 yrange : (*ymin*, *yheight*) 

2839 The y-position and extend for all the rectangles. 

2840 

2841 Returns 

2842 ------- 

2843 `~.collections.PolyCollection` 

2844 

2845 Other Parameters 

2846 ---------------- 

2847 data : indexable object, optional 

2848 DATA_PARAMETER_PLACEHOLDER 

2849 **kwargs : `.PolyCollection` properties 

2850 

2851 Each *kwarg* can be either a single argument applying to all 

2852 rectangles, e.g.:: 

2853 

2854 facecolors='black' 

2855 

2856 or a sequence of arguments over which is cycled, e.g.:: 

2857 

2858 facecolors=('black', 'blue') 

2859 

2860 would create interleaving black and blue rectangles. 

2861 

2862 Supported keywords: 

2863 

2864 %(PolyCollection:kwdoc)s 

2865 """ 

2866 # process the unit information 

2867 xdata = cbook._safe_first_finite(xranges) if len(xranges) else None 

2868 ydata = cbook._safe_first_finite(yrange) if len(yrange) else None 

2869 self._process_unit_info( 

2870 [("x", xdata), ("y", ydata)], kwargs, convert=False) 

2871 

2872 vertices = [] 

2873 y0, dy = yrange 

2874 y0, y1 = self.convert_yunits((y0, y0 + dy)) 

2875 for xr in xranges: # convert the absolute values, not the x and dx 

2876 try: 

2877 x0, dx = xr 

2878 except Exception: 

2879 raise ValueError( 

2880 "each range in xrange must be a sequence with two " 

2881 "elements (i.e. xrange must be an (N, 2) array)") from None 

2882 x0, x1 = self.convert_xunits((x0, x0 + dx)) 

2883 vertices.append([(x0, y0), (x0, y1), (x1, y1), (x1, y0)]) 

2884 

2885 col = mcoll.PolyCollection(np.array(vertices), **kwargs) 

2886 self.add_collection(col, autolim=True) 

2887 self._request_autoscale_view() 

2888 

2889 return col 

2890 

2891 @_preprocess_data() 

2892 @_api.delete_parameter("3.6", "use_line_collection") 

2893 def stem(self, *args, linefmt=None, markerfmt=None, basefmt=None, bottom=0, 

2894 label=None, use_line_collection=True, orientation='vertical'): 

2895 """ 

2896 Create a stem plot. 

2897 

2898 A stem plot draws lines perpendicular to a baseline at each location 

2899 *locs* from the baseline to *heads*, and places a marker there. For 

2900 vertical stem plots (the default), the *locs* are *x* positions, and 

2901 the *heads* are *y* values. For horizontal stem plots, the *locs* are 

2902 *y* positions, and the *heads* are *x* values. 

2903 

2904 Call signature:: 

2905 

2906 stem([locs,] heads, linefmt=None, markerfmt=None, basefmt=None) 

2907 

2908 The *locs*-positions are optional. *linefmt* may be provided as 

2909 positional, but all other formats must be provided as keyword 

2910 arguments. 

2911 

2912 Parameters 

2913 ---------- 

2914 locs : array-like, default: (0, 1, ..., len(heads) - 1) 

2915 For vertical stem plots, the x-positions of the stems. 

2916 For horizontal stem plots, the y-positions of the stems. 

2917 

2918 heads : array-like 

2919 For vertical stem plots, the y-values of the stem heads. 

2920 For horizontal stem plots, the x-values of the stem heads. 

2921 

2922 linefmt : str, optional 

2923 A string defining the color and/or linestyle of the vertical lines: 

2924 

2925 ========= ============= 

2926 Character Line Style 

2927 ========= ============= 

2928 ``'-'`` solid line 

2929 ``'--'`` dashed line 

2930 ``'-.'`` dash-dot line 

2931 ``':'`` dotted line 

2932 ========= ============= 

2933 

2934 Default: 'C0-', i.e. solid line with the first color of the color 

2935 cycle. 

2936 

2937 Note: Markers specified through this parameter (e.g. 'x') will be 

2938 silently ignored (unless using ``use_line_collection=False``). 

2939 Instead, markers should be specified using *markerfmt*. 

2940 

2941 markerfmt : str, optional 

2942 A string defining the color and/or shape of the markers at the stem 

2943 heads. If the marker is not given, use the marker 'o', i.e. filled 

2944 circles. If the color is not given, use the color from *linefmt*. 

2945 

2946 basefmt : str, default: 'C3-' ('C2-' in classic mode) 

2947 A format string defining the properties of the baseline. 

2948 

2949 orientation : {'vertical', 'horizontal'}, default: 'vertical' 

2950 If 'vertical', will produce a plot with stems oriented vertically, 

2951 If 'horizontal', the stems will be oriented horizontally. 

2952 

2953 bottom : float, default: 0 

2954 The y/x-position of the baseline (depending on orientation). 

2955 

2956 label : str, default: None 

2957 The label to use for the stems in legends. 

2958 

2959 use_line_collection : bool, default: True 

2960 *Deprecated since 3.6* 

2961 

2962 If ``True``, store and plot the stem lines as a 

2963 `~.collections.LineCollection` instead of individual lines, which 

2964 significantly increases performance. If ``False``, defaults to the 

2965 old behavior of using a list of `.Line2D` objects. 

2966 

2967 data : indexable object, optional 

2968 DATA_PARAMETER_PLACEHOLDER 

2969 

2970 Returns 

2971 ------- 

2972 `.StemContainer` 

2973 The container may be treated like a tuple 

2974 (*markerline*, *stemlines*, *baseline*) 

2975 

2976 Notes 

2977 ----- 

2978 .. seealso:: 

2979 The MATLAB function 

2980 `stem <https://www.mathworks.com/help/matlab/ref/stem.html>`_ 

2981 which inspired this method. 

2982 """ 

2983 if not 1 <= len(args) <= 3: 2983 ↛ 2984line 2983 didn't jump to line 2984, because the condition on line 2983 was never true

2984 raise TypeError('stem expected between 1 or 3 positional ' 

2985 f'arguments, got {args}') 

2986 _api.check_in_list(['horizontal', 'vertical'], orientation=orientation) 

2987 

2988 if len(args) == 1: 

2989 heads, = args 

2990 locs = np.arange(len(heads)) 

2991 args = () 

2992 elif isinstance(args[1], str): 

2993 heads, *args = args 

2994 locs = np.arange(len(heads)) 

2995 else: 

2996 locs, heads, *args = args 

2997 

2998 if orientation == 'vertical': 

2999 locs, heads = self._process_unit_info([("x", locs), ("y", heads)]) 

3000 else: # horizontal 

3001 heads, locs = self._process_unit_info([("x", heads), ("y", locs)]) 

3002 

3003 # resolve line format 

3004 if linefmt is None: 

3005 linefmt = args[0] if len(args) > 0 else "C0-" 

3006 linestyle, linemarker, linecolor = _process_plot_format(linefmt) 

3007 

3008 # resolve marker format 

3009 if markerfmt is None: 

3010 # if not given as kwarg, fall back to 'o' 

3011 markerfmt = "o" 

3012 if markerfmt == '': 

3013 markerfmt = ' ' # = empty line style; '' would resolve rcParams 

3014 markerstyle, markermarker, markercolor = \ 

3015 _process_plot_format(markerfmt) 

3016 if markermarker is None: 

3017 markermarker = 'o' 

3018 if markerstyle is None: 

3019 markerstyle = 'None' 

3020 if markercolor is None: 

3021 markercolor = linecolor 

3022 

3023 # resolve baseline format 

3024 if basefmt is None: 

3025 basefmt = ("C2-" if mpl.rcParams["_internal.classic_mode"] else 

3026 "C3-") 

3027 basestyle, basemarker, basecolor = _process_plot_format(basefmt) 

3028 

3029 # New behaviour in 3.1 is to use a LineCollection for the stemlines 

3030 if use_line_collection: 

3031 if linestyle is None: 

3032 linestyle = mpl.rcParams['lines.linestyle'] 

3033 xlines = self.vlines if orientation == "vertical" else self.hlines 

3034 stemlines = xlines( 

3035 locs, bottom, heads, 

3036 colors=linecolor, linestyles=linestyle, label="_nolegend_") 

3037 # Old behaviour is to plot each of the lines individually 

3038 else: 

3039 stemlines = [] 

3040 for loc, head in zip(locs, heads): 

3041 if orientation == 'horizontal': 

3042 xs = [bottom, head] 

3043 ys = [loc, loc] 

3044 else: 

3045 xs = [loc, loc] 

3046 ys = [bottom, head] 

3047 l, = self.plot(xs, ys, 

3048 color=linecolor, linestyle=linestyle, 

3049 marker=linemarker, label="_nolegend_") 

3050 stemlines.append(l) 

3051 

3052 if orientation == 'horizontal': 

3053 marker_x = heads 

3054 marker_y = locs 

3055 baseline_x = [bottom, bottom] 

3056 baseline_y = [np.min(locs), np.max(locs)] 

3057 else: 

3058 marker_x = locs 

3059 marker_y = heads 

3060 baseline_x = [np.min(locs), np.max(locs)] 

3061 baseline_y = [bottom, bottom] 

3062 

3063 markerline, = self.plot(marker_x, marker_y, 

3064 color=markercolor, linestyle=markerstyle, 

3065 marker=markermarker, label="_nolegend_") 

3066 

3067 baseline, = self.plot(baseline_x, baseline_y, 

3068 color=basecolor, linestyle=basestyle, 

3069 marker=basemarker, label="_nolegend_") 

3070 

3071 stem_container = StemContainer((markerline, stemlines, baseline), 

3072 label=label) 

3073 self.add_container(stem_container) 

3074 return stem_container 

3075 

3076 @_preprocess_data(replace_names=["x", "explode", "labels", "colors"]) 

3077 def pie(self, x, explode=None, labels=None, colors=None, 

3078 autopct=None, pctdistance=0.6, shadow=False, labeldistance=1.1, 

3079 startangle=0, radius=1, counterclock=True, 

3080 wedgeprops=None, textprops=None, center=(0, 0), 

3081 frame=False, rotatelabels=False, *, normalize=True, hatch=None): 

3082 """ 

3083 Plot a pie chart. 

3084 

3085 Make a pie chart of array *x*. The fractional area of each wedge is 

3086 given by ``x/sum(x)``. 

3087 

3088 The wedges are plotted counterclockwise, by default starting from the 

3089 x-axis. 

3090 

3091 Parameters 

3092 ---------- 

3093 x : 1D array-like 

3094 The wedge sizes. 

3095 

3096 explode : array-like, default: None 

3097 If not *None*, is a ``len(x)`` array which specifies the fraction 

3098 of the radius with which to offset each wedge. 

3099 

3100 labels : list, default: None 

3101 A sequence of strings providing the labels for each wedge 

3102 

3103 colors : array-like, default: None 

3104 A sequence of colors through which the pie chart will cycle. If 

3105 *None*, will use the colors in the currently active cycle. 

3106 

3107 hatch : str or list, default: None 

3108 Hatching pattern applied to all pie wedges or sequence of patterns 

3109 through which the chart will cycle. For a list of valid patterns, 

3110 see :doc:`/gallery/shapes_and_collections/hatch_style_reference`. 

3111 

3112 .. versionadded:: 3.7 

3113 

3114 autopct : None or str or callable, default: None 

3115 If not *None*, *autopct* is a string or function used to label the 

3116 wedges with their numeric value. The label will be placed inside 

3117 the wedge. If *autopct* is a format string, the label will be 

3118 ``fmt % pct``. If *autopct* is a function, then it will be called. 

3119 

3120 pctdistance : float, default: 0.6 

3121 The relative distance along the radius at which the the text 

3122 generated by *autopct* is drawn. To draw the text outside the pie, 

3123 set *pctdistance* > 1. This parameter is ignored if *autopct* is 

3124 ``None``. 

3125 

3126 labeldistance : float or None, default: 1.1 

3127 The relative distance along the radius at which the labels are 

3128 drawn. To draw the labels inside the pie, set *labeldistance* < 1. 

3129 If set to ``None``, labels are not drawn but are still stored for 

3130 use in `.legend`. 

3131 

3132 shadow : bool, default: False 

3133 Draw a shadow beneath the pie. 

3134 

3135 startangle : float, default: 0 degrees 

3136 The angle by which the start of the pie is rotated, 

3137 counterclockwise from the x-axis. 

3138 

3139 radius : float, default: 1 

3140 The radius of the pie. 

3141 

3142 counterclock : bool, default: True 

3143 Specify fractions direction, clockwise or counterclockwise. 

3144 

3145 wedgeprops : dict, default: None 

3146 Dict of arguments passed to each `.patches.Wedge` of the pie. 

3147 For example, ``wedgeprops = {'linewidth': 3}`` sets the width of 

3148 the wedge border lines equal to 3. By default, ``clip_on=False``. 

3149 When there is a conflict between these properties and other 

3150 keywords, properties passed to *wedgeprops* take precedence. 

3151 

3152 textprops : dict, default: None 

3153 Dict of arguments to pass to the text objects. 

3154 

3155 center : (float, float), default: (0, 0) 

3156 The coordinates of the center of the chart. 

3157 

3158 frame : bool, default: False 

3159 Plot Axes frame with the chart if true. 

3160 

3161 rotatelabels : bool, default: False 

3162 Rotate each label to the angle of the corresponding slice if true. 

3163 

3164 normalize : bool, default: True 

3165 When *True*, always make a full pie by normalizing x so that 

3166 ``sum(x) == 1``. *False* makes a partial pie if ``sum(x) <= 1`` 

3167 and raises a `ValueError` for ``sum(x) > 1``. 

3168 

3169 data : indexable object, optional 

3170 DATA_PARAMETER_PLACEHOLDER 

3171 

3172 Returns 

3173 ------- 

3174 patches : list 

3175 A sequence of `matplotlib.patches.Wedge` instances 

3176 

3177 texts : list 

3178 A list of the label `.Text` instances. 

3179 

3180 autotexts : list 

3181 A list of `.Text` instances for the numeric labels. This will only 

3182 be returned if the parameter *autopct* is not *None*. 

3183 

3184 Notes 

3185 ----- 

3186 The pie chart will probably look best if the figure and Axes are 

3187 square, or the Axes aspect is equal. 

3188 This method sets the aspect ratio of the axis to "equal". 

3189 The Axes aspect ratio can be controlled with `.Axes.set_aspect`. 

3190 """ 

3191 self.set_aspect('equal') 

3192 # The use of float32 is "historical", but can't be changed without 

3193 # regenerating the test baselines. 

3194 x = np.asarray(x, np.float32) 

3195 if x.ndim > 1: 3195 ↛ 3196line 3195 didn't jump to line 3196, because the condition on line 3195 was never true

3196 raise ValueError("x must be 1D") 

3197 

3198 if np.any(x < 0): 

3199 raise ValueError("Wedge sizes 'x' must be non negative values") 

3200 

3201 sx = x.sum() 

3202 

3203 if normalize: 

3204 x = x / sx 

3205 elif sx > 1: 3205 ↛ 3206line 3205 didn't jump to line 3206, because the condition on line 3205 was never true

3206 raise ValueError('Cannot plot an unnormalized pie with sum(x) > 1') 

3207 if labels is None: 

3208 labels = [''] * len(x) 

3209 if explode is None: 

3210 explode = [0] * len(x) 

3211 if len(x) != len(labels): 3211 ↛ 3212line 3211 didn't jump to line 3212, because the condition on line 3211 was never true

3212 raise ValueError("'label' must be of length 'x'") 

3213 if len(x) != len(explode): 3213 ↛ 3214line 3213 didn't jump to line 3214, because the condition on line 3213 was never true

3214 raise ValueError("'explode' must be of length 'x'") 

3215 if colors is None: 

3216 get_next_color = self._get_patches_for_fill.get_next_color 

3217 else: 

3218 color_cycle = itertools.cycle(colors) 

3219 

3220 def get_next_color(): 

3221 return next(color_cycle) 

3222 

3223 hatch_cycle = itertools.cycle(np.atleast_1d(hatch)) 

3224 

3225 _api.check_isinstance(Real, radius=radius, startangle=startangle) 

3226 if radius <= 0: 3226 ↛ 3227line 3226 didn't jump to line 3227, because the condition on line 3226 was never true

3227 raise ValueError(f'radius must be a positive number, not {radius}') 

3228 

3229 # Starting theta1 is the start fraction of the circle 

3230 theta1 = startangle / 360 

3231 

3232 if wedgeprops is None: 

3233 wedgeprops = {} 

3234 if textprops is None: 

3235 textprops = {} 

3236 

3237 texts = [] 

3238 slices = [] 

3239 autotexts = [] 

3240 

3241 for frac, label, expl in zip(x, labels, explode): 

3242 x, y = center 

3243 theta2 = (theta1 + frac) if counterclock else (theta1 - frac) 

3244 thetam = 2 * np.pi * 0.5 * (theta1 + theta2) 

3245 x += expl * math.cos(thetam) 

3246 y += expl * math.sin(thetam) 

3247 

3248 w = mpatches.Wedge((x, y), radius, 360. * min(theta1, theta2), 

3249 360. * max(theta1, theta2), 

3250 facecolor=get_next_color(), 

3251 hatch=next(hatch_cycle), 

3252 clip_on=False, 

3253 label=label) 

3254 w.set(**wedgeprops) 

3255 slices.append(w) 

3256 self.add_patch(w) 

3257 

3258 if shadow: 

3259 # Make sure to add a shadow after the call to add_patch so the 

3260 # figure and transform props will be set. 

3261 shad = mpatches.Shadow(w, -0.02, -0.02, label='_nolegend_') 

3262 self.add_patch(shad) 

3263 

3264 if labeldistance is not None: 

3265 xt = x + labeldistance * radius * math.cos(thetam) 

3266 yt = y + labeldistance * radius * math.sin(thetam) 

3267 label_alignment_h = 'left' if xt > 0 else 'right' 

3268 label_alignment_v = 'center' 

3269 label_rotation = 'horizontal' 

3270 if rotatelabels: 

3271 label_alignment_v = 'bottom' if yt > 0 else 'top' 

3272 label_rotation = (np.rad2deg(thetam) 

3273 + (0 if xt > 0 else 180)) 

3274 t = self.text(xt, yt, label, 

3275 clip_on=False, 

3276 horizontalalignment=label_alignment_h, 

3277 verticalalignment=label_alignment_v, 

3278 rotation=label_rotation, 

3279 size=mpl.rcParams['xtick.labelsize']) 

3280 t.set(**textprops) 

3281 texts.append(t) 

3282 

3283 if autopct is not None: 

3284 xt = x + pctdistance * radius * math.cos(thetam) 

3285 yt = y + pctdistance * radius * math.sin(thetam) 

3286 if isinstance(autopct, str): 3286 ↛ 3288line 3286 didn't jump to line 3288, because the condition on line 3286 was never false

3287 s = autopct % (100. * frac) 

3288 elif callable(autopct): 

3289 s = autopct(100. * frac) 

3290 else: 

3291 raise TypeError( 

3292 'autopct must be callable or a format string') 

3293 t = self.text(xt, yt, s, 

3294 clip_on=False, 

3295 horizontalalignment='center', 

3296 verticalalignment='center') 

3297 t.set(**textprops) 

3298 autotexts.append(t) 

3299 

3300 theta1 = theta2 

3301 

3302 if frame: 

3303 self._request_autoscale_view() 

3304 else: 

3305 self.set(frame_on=False, xticks=[], yticks=[], 

3306 xlim=(-1.25 + center[0], 1.25 + center[0]), 

3307 ylim=(-1.25 + center[1], 1.25 + center[1])) 

3308 

3309 if autopct is None: 

3310 return slices, texts 

3311 else: 

3312 return slices, texts, autotexts 

3313 

3314 @staticmethod 

3315 def _errorevery_to_mask(x, errorevery): 

3316 """ 

3317 Normalize `errorbar`'s *errorevery* to be a boolean mask for data *x*. 

3318 

3319 This function is split out to be usable both by 2D and 3D errorbars. 

3320 """ 

3321 if isinstance(errorevery, Integral): 

3322 errorevery = (0, errorevery) 

3323 if isinstance(errorevery, tuple): 

3324 if (len(errorevery) == 2 and 

3325 isinstance(errorevery[0], Integral) and 

3326 isinstance(errorevery[1], Integral)): 

3327 errorevery = slice(errorevery[0], None, errorevery[1]) 

3328 else: 

3329 raise ValueError( 

3330 f'{errorevery=!r} is a not a tuple of two integers') 

3331 elif isinstance(errorevery, slice): 

3332 pass 

3333 elif not isinstance(errorevery, str) and np.iterable(errorevery): 

3334 try: 

3335 x[errorevery] # fancy indexing 

3336 except (ValueError, IndexError) as err: 

3337 raise ValueError( 

3338 f"{errorevery=!r} is iterable but not a valid NumPy fancy " 

3339 "index to match 'xerr'/'yerr'") from err 

3340 else: 

3341 raise ValueError(f"{errorevery=!r} is not a recognized value") 

3342 everymask = np.zeros(len(x), bool) 

3343 everymask[errorevery] = True 

3344 return everymask 

3345 

3346 @_preprocess_data(replace_names=["x", "y", "xerr", "yerr"], 

3347 label_namer="y") 

3348 @_docstring.dedent_interpd 

3349 def errorbar(self, x, y, yerr=None, xerr=None, 

3350 fmt='', ecolor=None, elinewidth=None, capsize=None, 

3351 barsabove=False, lolims=False, uplims=False, 

3352 xlolims=False, xuplims=False, errorevery=1, capthick=None, 

3353 **kwargs): 

3354 """ 

3355 Plot y versus x as lines and/or markers with attached errorbars. 

3356 

3357 *x*, *y* define the data locations, *xerr*, *yerr* define the errorbar 

3358 sizes. By default, this draws the data markers/lines as well the 

3359 errorbars. Use fmt='none' to draw errorbars without any data markers. 

3360 

3361 .. versionadded:: 3.7 

3362 Caps and error lines are drawn in polar coordinates on polar plots. 

3363 

3364 

3365 Parameters 

3366 ---------- 

3367 x, y : float or array-like 

3368 The data positions. 

3369 

3370 xerr, yerr : float or array-like, shape(N,) or shape(2, N), optional 

3371 The errorbar sizes: 

3372 

3373 - scalar: Symmetric +/- values for all data points. 

3374 - shape(N,): Symmetric +/-values for each data point. 

3375 - shape(2, N): Separate - and + values for each bar. First row 

3376 contains the lower errors, the second row contains the upper 

3377 errors. 

3378 - *None*: No errorbar. 

3379 

3380 All values must be >= 0. 

3381 

3382 See :doc:`/gallery/statistics/errorbar_features` 

3383 for an example on the usage of ``xerr`` and ``yerr``. 

3384 

3385 fmt : str, default: '' 

3386 The format for the data points / data lines. See `.plot` for 

3387 details. 

3388 

3389 Use 'none' (case-insensitive) to plot errorbars without any data 

3390 markers. 

3391 

3392 ecolor : color, default: None 

3393 The color of the errorbar lines. If None, use the color of the 

3394 line connecting the markers. 

3395 

3396 elinewidth : float, default: None 

3397 The linewidth of the errorbar lines. If None, the linewidth of 

3398 the current style is used. 

3399 

3400 capsize : float, default: :rc:`errorbar.capsize` 

3401 The length of the error bar caps in points. 

3402 

3403 capthick : float, default: None 

3404 An alias to the keyword argument *markeredgewidth* (a.k.a. *mew*). 

3405 This setting is a more sensible name for the property that 

3406 controls the thickness of the error bar cap in points. For 

3407 backwards compatibility, if *mew* or *markeredgewidth* are given, 

3408 then they will over-ride *capthick*. This may change in future 

3409 releases. 

3410 

3411 barsabove : bool, default: False 

3412 If True, will plot the errorbars above the plot 

3413 symbols. Default is below. 

3414 

3415 lolims, uplims, xlolims, xuplims : bool, default: False 

3416 These arguments can be used to indicate that a value gives only 

3417 upper/lower limits. In that case a caret symbol is used to 

3418 indicate this. *lims*-arguments may be scalars, or array-likes of 

3419 the same length as *xerr* and *yerr*. To use limits with inverted 

3420 axes, `~.Axes.set_xlim` or `~.Axes.set_ylim` must be called before 

3421 :meth:`errorbar`. Note the tricky parameter names: setting e.g. 

3422 *lolims* to True means that the y-value is a *lower* limit of the 

3423 True value, so, only an *upward*-pointing arrow will be drawn! 

3424 

3425 errorevery : int or (int, int), default: 1 

3426 draws error bars on a subset of the data. *errorevery* =N draws 

3427 error bars on the points (x[::N], y[::N]). 

3428 *errorevery* =(start, N) draws error bars on the points 

3429 (x[start::N], y[start::N]). e.g. errorevery=(6, 3) 

3430 adds error bars to the data at (x[6], x[9], x[12], x[15], ...). 

3431 Used to avoid overlapping error bars when two series share x-axis 

3432 values. 

3433 

3434 Returns 

3435 ------- 

3436 `.ErrorbarContainer` 

3437 The container contains: 

3438 

3439 - plotline: `.Line2D` instance of x, y plot markers and/or line. 

3440 - caplines: A tuple of `.Line2D` instances of the error bar caps. 

3441 - barlinecols: A tuple of `.LineCollection` with the horizontal and 

3442 vertical error ranges. 

3443 

3444 Other Parameters 

3445 ---------------- 

3446 data : indexable object, optional 

3447 DATA_PARAMETER_PLACEHOLDER 

3448 

3449 **kwargs 

3450 All other keyword arguments are passed on to the `~.Axes.plot` call 

3451 drawing the markers. For example, this code makes big red squares 

3452 with thick green edges:: 

3453 

3454 x, y, yerr = rand(3, 10) 

3455 errorbar(x, y, yerr, marker='s', mfc='red', 

3456 mec='green', ms=20, mew=4) 

3457 

3458 where *mfc*, *mec*, *ms* and *mew* are aliases for the longer 

3459 property names, *markerfacecolor*, *markeredgecolor*, *markersize* 

3460 and *markeredgewidth*. 

3461 

3462 Valid kwargs for the marker properties are: 

3463 

3464 - *dashes* 

3465 - *dash_capstyle* 

3466 - *dash_joinstyle* 

3467 - *drawstyle* 

3468 - *fillstyle* 

3469 - *linestyle* 

3470 - *marker* 

3471 - *markeredgecolor* 

3472 - *markeredgewidth* 

3473 - *markerfacecolor* 

3474 - *markerfacecoloralt* 

3475 - *markersize* 

3476 - *markevery* 

3477 - *solid_capstyle* 

3478 - *solid_joinstyle* 

3479 

3480 Refer to the corresponding `.Line2D` property for more details: 

3481 

3482 %(Line2D:kwdoc)s 

3483 """ 

3484 kwargs = cbook.normalize_kwargs(kwargs, mlines.Line2D) 

3485 # Drop anything that comes in as None to use the default instead. 

3486 kwargs = {k: v for k, v in kwargs.items() if v is not None} 

3487 kwargs.setdefault('zorder', 2) 

3488 

3489 # Casting to object arrays preserves units. 

3490 if not isinstance(x, np.ndarray): 

3491 x = np.asarray(x, dtype=object) 

3492 if not isinstance(y, np.ndarray): 

3493 y = np.asarray(y, dtype=object) 

3494 

3495 def _upcast_err(err): 

3496 """ 

3497 Safely handle tuple of containers that carry units. 

3498 

3499 This function covers the case where the input to the xerr/yerr is a 

3500 length 2 tuple of equal length ndarray-subclasses that carry the 

3501 unit information in the container. 

3502 

3503 If we have a tuple of nested numpy array (subclasses), we defer 

3504 coercing the units to be consistent to the underlying unit 

3505 library (and implicitly the broadcasting). 

3506 

3507 Otherwise, fallback to casting to an object array. 

3508 """ 

3509 

3510 if ( 

3511 # make sure it is not a scalar 

3512 np.iterable(err) and 

3513 # and it is not empty 

3514 len(err) > 0 and 

3515 # and the first element is an array sub-class use 

3516 # safe_first_element because getitem is index-first not 

3517 # location first on pandas objects so err[0] almost always 

3518 # fails. 

3519 isinstance(cbook._safe_first_finite(err), np.ndarray) 

3520 ): 

3521 # Get the type of the first element 

3522 atype = type(cbook._safe_first_finite(err)) 

3523 # Promote the outer container to match the inner container 

3524 if atype is np.ndarray: 3524 ↛ 3530line 3524 didn't jump to line 3530, because the condition on line 3524 was never false

3525 # Converts using np.asarray, because data cannot 

3526 # be directly passed to init of np.ndarray 

3527 return np.asarray(err, dtype=object) 

3528 # If atype is not np.ndarray, directly pass data to init. 

3529 # This works for types such as unyts and astropy units 

3530 return atype(err) 

3531 # Otherwise wrap it in an object array 

3532 return np.asarray(err, dtype=object) 

3533 

3534 if xerr is not None and not isinstance(xerr, np.ndarray): 

3535 xerr = _upcast_err(xerr) 

3536 if yerr is not None and not isinstance(yerr, np.ndarray): 

3537 yerr = _upcast_err(yerr) 

3538 x, y = np.atleast_1d(x, y) # Make sure all the args are iterable. 

3539 if len(x) != len(y): 3539 ↛ 3540line 3539 didn't jump to line 3540, because the condition on line 3539 was never true

3540 raise ValueError("'x' and 'y' must have the same size") 

3541 

3542 everymask = self._errorevery_to_mask(x, errorevery) 

3543 

3544 label = kwargs.pop("label", None) 

3545 kwargs['label'] = '_nolegend_' 

3546 

3547 # Create the main line and determine overall kwargs for child artists. 

3548 # We avoid calling self.plot() directly, or self._get_lines(), because 

3549 # that would call self._process_unit_info again, and do other indirect 

3550 # data processing. 

3551 (data_line, base_style), = self._get_lines._plot_args( 

3552 (x, y) if fmt == '' else (x, y, fmt), kwargs, return_kwargs=True) 

3553 

3554 # Do this after creating `data_line` to avoid modifying `base_style`. 

3555 if barsabove: 3555 ↛ 3556line 3555 didn't jump to line 3556, because the condition on line 3555 was never true

3556 data_line.set_zorder(kwargs['zorder'] - .1) 

3557 else: 

3558 data_line.set_zorder(kwargs['zorder'] + .1) 

3559 

3560 # Add line to plot, or throw it away and use it to determine kwargs. 

3561 if fmt.lower() != 'none': 

3562 self.add_line(data_line) 

3563 else: 

3564 data_line = None 

3565 # Remove alpha=0 color that _get_lines._plot_args returns for 

3566 # 'none' format, and replace it with user-specified color, if 

3567 # supplied. 

3568 base_style.pop('color') 

3569 if 'color' in kwargs: 

3570 base_style['color'] = kwargs.pop('color') 

3571 

3572 if 'color' not in base_style: 

3573 base_style['color'] = 'C0' 

3574 if ecolor is None: 

3575 ecolor = base_style['color'] 

3576 

3577 # Eject any line-specific information from format string, as it's not 

3578 # needed for bars or caps. 

3579 for key in ['marker', 'markersize', 'markerfacecolor', 

3580 'markerfacecoloralt', 

3581 'markeredgewidth', 'markeredgecolor', 'markevery', 

3582 'linestyle', 'fillstyle', 'drawstyle', 'dash_capstyle', 

3583 'dash_joinstyle', 'solid_capstyle', 'solid_joinstyle', 

3584 'dashes']: 

3585 base_style.pop(key, None) 

3586 

3587 # Make the style dict for the line collections (the bars). 

3588 eb_lines_style = {**base_style, 'color': ecolor} 

3589 

3590 if elinewidth is not None: 

3591 eb_lines_style['linewidth'] = elinewidth 

3592 elif 'linewidth' in kwargs: 

3593 eb_lines_style['linewidth'] = kwargs['linewidth'] 

3594 

3595 for key in ('transform', 'alpha', 'zorder', 'rasterized'): 

3596 if key in kwargs: 

3597 eb_lines_style[key] = kwargs[key] 

3598 

3599 # Make the style dict for caps (the "hats"). 

3600 eb_cap_style = {**base_style, 'linestyle': 'none'} 

3601 if capsize is None: 

3602 capsize = mpl.rcParams["errorbar.capsize"] 

3603 if capsize > 0: 

3604 eb_cap_style['markersize'] = 2. * capsize 

3605 if capthick is not None: 

3606 eb_cap_style['markeredgewidth'] = capthick 

3607 

3608 # For backwards-compat, allow explicit setting of 

3609 # 'markeredgewidth' to over-ride capthick. 

3610 for key in ('markeredgewidth', 'transform', 'alpha', 

3611 'zorder', 'rasterized'): 

3612 if key in kwargs: 

3613 eb_cap_style[key] = kwargs[key] 

3614 eb_cap_style['color'] = ecolor 

3615 

3616 barcols = [] 

3617 caplines = {'x': [], 'y': []} 

3618 

3619 # Vectorized fancy-indexer. 

3620 def apply_mask(arrays, mask): 

3621 return [array[mask] for array in arrays] 

3622 

3623 # dep: dependent dataset, indep: independent dataset 

3624 for (dep_axis, dep, err, lolims, uplims, indep, lines_func, 

3625 marker, lomarker, himarker) in [ 

3626 ("x", x, xerr, xlolims, xuplims, y, self.hlines, 

3627 "|", mlines.CARETRIGHTBASE, mlines.CARETLEFTBASE), 

3628 ("y", y, yerr, lolims, uplims, x, self.vlines, 

3629 "_", mlines.CARETUPBASE, mlines.CARETDOWNBASE), 

3630 ]: 

3631 if err is None: 

3632 continue 

3633 lolims = np.broadcast_to(lolims, len(dep)).astype(bool) 

3634 uplims = np.broadcast_to(uplims, len(dep)).astype(bool) 

3635 try: 

3636 np.broadcast_to(err, (2, len(dep))) 

3637 except ValueError: 

3638 raise ValueError( 

3639 f"'{dep_axis}err' (shape: {np.shape(err)}) must be a " 

3640 f"scalar or a 1D or (2, n) array-like whose shape matches " 

3641 f"'{dep_axis}' (shape: {np.shape(dep)})") from None 

3642 res = np.zeros(err.shape, dtype=bool) # Default in case of nan 

3643 if np.any(np.less(err, -err, out=res, where=(err == err))): 

3644 # like err<0, but also works for timedelta and nan. 

3645 raise ValueError( 

3646 f"'{dep_axis}err' must not contain negative values") 

3647 # This is like 

3648 # elow, ehigh = np.broadcast_to(...) 

3649 # return dep - elow * ~lolims, dep + ehigh * ~uplims 

3650 # except that broadcast_to would strip units. 

3651 low, high = dep + np.row_stack([-(1 - lolims), 1 - uplims]) * err 

3652 barcols.append(lines_func( 

3653 *apply_mask([indep, low, high], everymask), **eb_lines_style)) 

3654 if self.name == "polar" and dep_axis == "x": 

3655 for b in barcols: 

3656 for p in b.get_paths(): 

3657 p._interpolation_steps = 2 

3658 # Normal errorbars for points without upper/lower limits. 

3659 nolims = ~(lolims | uplims) 

3660 if nolims.any() and capsize > 0: 

3661 indep_masked, lo_masked, hi_masked = apply_mask( 

3662 [indep, low, high], nolims & everymask) 

3663 for lh_masked in [lo_masked, hi_masked]: 

3664 # Since this has to work for x and y as dependent data, we 

3665 # first set both x and y to the independent variable and 

3666 # overwrite the respective dependent data in a second step. 

3667 line = mlines.Line2D(indep_masked, indep_masked, 

3668 marker=marker, **eb_cap_style) 

3669 line.set(**{f"{dep_axis}data": lh_masked}) 

3670 caplines[dep_axis].append(line) 

3671 for idx, (lims, hl) in enumerate([(lolims, high), (uplims, low)]): 

3672 if not lims.any(): 

3673 continue 

3674 hlmarker = ( 

3675 himarker 

3676 if self._axis_map[dep_axis].get_inverted() ^ idx 

3677 else lomarker) 

3678 x_masked, y_masked, hl_masked = apply_mask( 

3679 [x, y, hl], lims & everymask) 

3680 # As above, we set the dependent data in a second step. 

3681 line = mlines.Line2D(x_masked, y_masked, 

3682 marker=hlmarker, **eb_cap_style) 

3683 line.set(**{f"{dep_axis}data": hl_masked}) 

3684 caplines[dep_axis].append(line) 

3685 if capsize > 0: 

3686 caplines[dep_axis].append(mlines.Line2D( 

3687 x_masked, y_masked, marker=marker, **eb_cap_style)) 

3688 if self.name == 'polar': 

3689 for axis in caplines: 

3690 for l in caplines[axis]: 

3691 # Rotate caps to be perpendicular to the error bars 

3692 for theta, r in zip(l.get_xdata(), l.get_ydata()): 

3693 rotation = mtransforms.Affine2D().rotate(theta) 

3694 if axis == 'y': 

3695 rotation.rotate(-np.pi / 2) 

3696 ms = mmarkers.MarkerStyle(marker=marker, 

3697 transform=rotation) 

3698 self.add_line(mlines.Line2D([theta], [r], marker=ms, 

3699 **eb_cap_style)) 

3700 else: 

3701 for axis in caplines: 

3702 for l in caplines[axis]: 

3703 self.add_line(l) 

3704 

3705 self._request_autoscale_view() 

3706 caplines = caplines['x'] + caplines['y'] 

3707 errorbar_container = ErrorbarContainer( 

3708 (data_line, tuple(caplines), tuple(barcols)), 

3709 has_xerr=(xerr is not None), has_yerr=(yerr is not None), 

3710 label=label) 

3711 self.containers.append(errorbar_container) 

3712 

3713 return errorbar_container # (l0, caplines, barcols) 

3714 

3715 @_preprocess_data() 

3716 def boxplot(self, x, notch=None, sym=None, vert=None, whis=None, 

3717 positions=None, widths=None, patch_artist=None, 

3718 bootstrap=None, usermedians=None, conf_intervals=None, 

3719 meanline=None, showmeans=None, showcaps=None, 

3720 showbox=None, showfliers=None, boxprops=None, 

3721 labels=None, flierprops=None, medianprops=None, 

3722 meanprops=None, capprops=None, whiskerprops=None, 

3723 manage_ticks=True, autorange=False, zorder=None, 

3724 capwidths=None): 

3725 """ 

3726 Draw a box and whisker plot. 

3727 

3728 The box extends from the first quartile (Q1) to the third 

3729 quartile (Q3) of the data, with a line at the median. 

3730 The whiskers extend from the box to the farthest data point 

3731 lying within 1.5x the inter-quartile range (IQR) from the box. 

3732 Flier points are those past the end of the whiskers. 

3733 See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Box_plot for reference. 

3734 

3735 .. code-block:: none 

3736 

3737 Q1-1.5IQR Q1 median Q3 Q3+1.5IQR 

3738 |-----:-----| 

3739 o |--------| : |--------| o o 

3740 |-----:-----| 

3741 flier <-----------> fliers 

3742 IQR 

3743 

3744 

3745 Parameters 

3746 ---------- 

3747 x : Array or a sequence of vectors. 

3748 The input data. If a 2D array, a boxplot is drawn for each column 

3749 in *x*. If a sequence of 1D arrays, a boxplot is drawn for each 

3750 array in *x*. 

3751 

3752 notch : bool, default: False 

3753 Whether to draw a notched boxplot (`True`), or a rectangular 

3754 boxplot (`False`). The notches represent the confidence interval 

3755 (CI) around the median. The documentation for *bootstrap* 

3756 describes how the locations of the notches are computed by 

3757 default, but their locations may also be overridden by setting the 

3758 *conf_intervals* parameter. 

3759 

3760 .. note:: 

3761 

3762 In cases where the values of the CI are less than the 

3763 lower quartile or greater than the upper quartile, the 

3764 notches will extend beyond the box, giving it a 

3765 distinctive "flipped" appearance. This is expected 

3766 behavior and consistent with other statistical 

3767 visualization packages. 

3768 

3769 sym : str, optional 

3770 The default symbol for flier points. An empty string ('') hides 

3771 the fliers. If `None`, then the fliers default to 'b+'. More 

3772 control is provided by the *flierprops* parameter. 

3773 

3774 vert : bool, default: True 

3775 If `True`, draws vertical boxes. 

3776 If `False`, draw horizontal boxes. 

3777 

3778 whis : float or (float, float), default: 1.5 

3779 The position of the whiskers. 

3780 

3781 If a float, the lower whisker is at the lowest datum above 

3782 ``Q1 - whis*(Q3-Q1)``, and the upper whisker at the highest datum 

3783 below ``Q3 + whis*(Q3-Q1)``, where Q1 and Q3 are the first and 

3784 third quartiles. The default value of ``whis = 1.5`` corresponds 

3785 to Tukey's original definition of boxplots. 

3786 

3787 If a pair of floats, they indicate the percentiles at which to 

3788 draw the whiskers (e.g., (5, 95)). In particular, setting this to 

3789 (0, 100) results in whiskers covering the whole range of the data. 

3790 

3791 In the edge case where ``Q1 == Q3``, *whis* is automatically set 

3792 to (0, 100) (cover the whole range of the data) if *autorange* is 

3793 True. 

3794 

3795 Beyond the whiskers, data are considered outliers and are plotted 

3796 as individual points. 

3797 

3798 bootstrap : int, optional 

3799 Specifies whether to bootstrap the confidence intervals 

3800 around the median for notched boxplots. If *bootstrap* is 

3801 None, no bootstrapping is performed, and notches are 

3802 calculated using a Gaussian-based asymptotic approximation 

3803 (see McGill, R., Tukey, J.W., and Larsen, W.A., 1978, and 

3804 Kendall and Stuart, 1967). Otherwise, bootstrap specifies 

3805 the number of times to bootstrap the median to determine its 

3806 95% confidence intervals. Values between 1000 and 10000 are 

3807 recommended. 

3808 

3809 usermedians : 1D array-like, optional 

3810 A 1D array-like of length ``len(x)``. Each entry that is not 

3811 `None` forces the value of the median for the corresponding 

3812 dataset. For entries that are `None`, the medians are computed 

3813 by Matplotlib as normal. 

3814 

3815 conf_intervals : array-like, optional 

3816 A 2D array-like of shape ``(len(x), 2)``. Each entry that is not 

3817 None forces the location of the corresponding notch (which is 

3818 only drawn if *notch* is `True`). For entries that are `None`, 

3819 the notches are computed by the method specified by the other 

3820 parameters (e.g., *bootstrap*). 

3821 

3822 positions : array-like, optional 

3823 The positions of the boxes. The ticks and limits are 

3824 automatically set to match the positions. Defaults to 

3825 ``range(1, N+1)`` where N is the number of boxes to be drawn. 

3826 

3827 widths : float or array-like 

3828 The widths of the boxes. The default is 0.5, or ``0.15*(distance 

3829 between extreme positions)``, if that is smaller. 

3830 

3831 patch_artist : bool, default: False 

3832 If `False` produces boxes with the Line2D artist. Otherwise, 

3833 boxes are drawn with Patch artists. 

3834 

3835 labels : sequence, optional 

3836 Labels for each dataset (one per dataset). 

3837 

3838 manage_ticks : bool, default: True 

3839 If True, the tick locations and labels will be adjusted to match 

3840 the boxplot positions. 

3841 

3842 autorange : bool, default: False 

3843 When `True` and the data are distributed such that the 25th and 

3844 75th percentiles are equal, *whis* is set to (0, 100) such 

3845 that the whisker ends are at the minimum and maximum of the data. 

3846 

3847 meanline : bool, default: False 

3848 If `True` (and *showmeans* is `True`), will try to render the 

3849 mean as a line spanning the full width of the box according to 

3850 *meanprops* (see below). Not recommended if *shownotches* is also 

3851 True. Otherwise, means will be shown as points. 

3852 

3853 zorder : float, default: ``Line2D.zorder = 2`` 

3854 The zorder of the boxplot. 

3855 

3856 Returns 

3857 ------- 

3858 dict 

3859 A dictionary mapping each component of the boxplot to a list 

3860 of the `.Line2D` instances created. That dictionary has the 

3861 following keys (assuming vertical boxplots): 

3862 

3863 - ``boxes``: the main body of the boxplot showing the 

3864 quartiles and the median's confidence intervals if 

3865 enabled. 

3866 

3867 - ``medians``: horizontal lines at the median of each box. 

3868 

3869 - ``whiskers``: the vertical lines extending to the most 

3870 extreme, non-outlier data points. 

3871 

3872 - ``caps``: the horizontal lines at the ends of the 

3873 whiskers. 

3874 

3875 - ``fliers``: points representing data that extend beyond 

3876 the whiskers (fliers). 

3877 

3878 - ``means``: points or lines representing the means. 

3879 

3880 Other Parameters 

3881 ---------------- 

3882 showcaps : bool, default: True 

3883 Show the caps on the ends of whiskers. 

3884 showbox : bool, default: True 

3885 Show the central box. 

3886 showfliers : bool, default: True 

3887 Show the outliers beyond the caps. 

3888 showmeans : bool, default: False 

3889 Show the arithmetic means. 

3890 capprops : dict, default: None 

3891 The style of the caps. 

3892 capwidths : float or array, default: None 

3893 The widths of the caps. 

3894 boxprops : dict, default: None 

3895 The style of the box. 

3896 whiskerprops : dict, default: None 

3897 The style of the whiskers. 

3898 flierprops : dict, default: None 

3899 The style of the fliers. 

3900 medianprops : dict, default: None 

3901 The style of the median. 

3902 meanprops : dict, default: None 

3903 The style of the mean. 

3904 data : indexable object, optional 

3905 DATA_PARAMETER_PLACEHOLDER 

3906 

3907 See Also 

3908 -------- 

3909 violinplot : Draw an estimate of the probability density function. 

3910 """ 

3911 

3912 # Missing arguments default to rcParams. 

3913 if whis is None: 3913 ↛ 3915line 3913 didn't jump to line 3915, because the condition on line 3913 was never false

3914 whis = mpl.rcParams['boxplot.whiskers'] 

3915 if bootstrap is None: 

3916 bootstrap = mpl.rcParams['boxplot.bootstrap'] 

3917 

3918 bxpstats = cbook.boxplot_stats(x, whis=whis, bootstrap=bootstrap, 

3919 labels=labels, autorange=autorange) 

3920 if notch is None: 

3921 notch = mpl.rcParams['boxplot.notch'] 

3922 if vert is None: 3922 ↛ 3924line 3922 didn't jump to line 3924, because the condition on line 3922 was never false

3923 vert = mpl.rcParams['boxplot.vertical'] 

3924 if patch_artist is None: 3924 ↛ 3926line 3924 didn't jump to line 3926, because the condition on line 3924 was never false

3925 patch_artist = mpl.rcParams['boxplot.patchartist'] 

3926 if meanline is None: 3926 ↛ 3928line 3926 didn't jump to line 3928, because the condition on line 3926 was never false

3927 meanline = mpl.rcParams['boxplot.meanline'] 

3928 if showmeans is None: 

3929 showmeans = mpl.rcParams['boxplot.showmeans'] 

3930 if showcaps is None: 3930 ↛ 3932line 3930 didn't jump to line 3932, because the condition on line 3930 was never false

3931 showcaps = mpl.rcParams['boxplot.showcaps'] 

3932 if showbox is None: 3932 ↛ 3934line 3932 didn't jump to line 3934, because the condition on line 3932 was never false

3933 showbox = mpl.rcParams['boxplot.showbox'] 

3934 if showfliers is None: 3934 ↛ 3937line 3934 didn't jump to line 3937, because the condition on line 3934 was never false

3935 showfliers = mpl.rcParams['boxplot.showfliers'] 

3936 

3937 if boxprops is None: 3937 ↛ 3939line 3937 didn't jump to line 3939, because the condition on line 3937 was never false

3938 boxprops = {} 

3939 if whiskerprops is None: 3939 ↛ 3941line 3939 didn't jump to line 3941, because the condition on line 3939 was never false

3940 whiskerprops = {} 

3941 if capprops is None: 3941 ↛ 3943line 3941 didn't jump to line 3943, because the condition on line 3941 was never false

3942 capprops = {} 

3943 if medianprops is None: 3943 ↛ 3945line 3943 didn't jump to line 3945, because the condition on line 3943 was never false

3944 medianprops = {} 

3945 if meanprops is None: 3945 ↛ 3947line 3945 didn't jump to line 3947, because the condition on line 3945 was never false

3946 meanprops = {} 

3947 if flierprops is None: 3947 ↛ 3950line 3947 didn't jump to line 3950, because the condition on line 3947 was never false

3948 flierprops = {} 

3949 

3950 if patch_artist: 

3951 boxprops['linestyle'] = 'solid' # Not consistent with bxp. 

3952 if 'color' in boxprops: 3952 ↛ 3953line 3952 didn't jump to line 3953, because the condition on line 3952 was never true

3953 boxprops['edgecolor'] = boxprops.pop('color') 

3954 

3955 # if non-default sym value, put it into the flier dictionary 

3956 # the logic for providing the default symbol ('b+') now lives 

3957 # in bxp in the initial value of flierkw 

3958 # handle all of the *sym* related logic here so we only have to pass 

3959 # on the flierprops dict. 

3960 if sym is not None: 

3961 # no-flier case, which should really be done with 

3962 # 'showfliers=False' but none-the-less deal with it to keep back 

3963 # compatibility 

3964 if sym == '': 3964 ↛ 3966line 3964 didn't jump to line 3966, because the condition on line 3964 was never true

3965 # blow away existing dict and make one for invisible markers 

3966 flierprops = dict(linestyle='none', marker='', color='none') 

3967 # turn the fliers off just to be safe 

3968 showfliers = False 

3969 # now process the symbol string 

3970 else: 

3971 # process the symbol string 

3972 # discarded linestyle 

3973 _, marker, color = _process_plot_format(sym) 

3974 # if we have a marker, use it 

3975 if marker is not None: 

3976 flierprops['marker'] = marker 

3977 # if we have a color, use it 

3978 if color is not None: 

3979 # assume that if color is passed in the user want 

3980 # filled symbol, if the users want more control use 

3981 # flierprops 

3982 flierprops['color'] = color 

3983 flierprops['markerfacecolor'] = color 

3984 flierprops['markeredgecolor'] = color 

3985 

3986 # replace medians if necessary: 

3987 if usermedians is not None: 

3988 if (len(np.ravel(usermedians)) != len(bxpstats) or 

3989 np.shape(usermedians)[0] != len(bxpstats)): 

3990 raise ValueError( 

3991 "'usermedians' and 'x' have different lengths") 

3992 else: 

3993 # reassign medians as necessary 

3994 for stats, med in zip(bxpstats, usermedians): 

3995 if med is not None: 

3996 stats['med'] = med 

3997 

3998 if conf_intervals is not None: 

3999 if len(conf_intervals) != len(bxpstats): 

4000 raise ValueError( 

4001 "'conf_intervals' and 'x' have different lengths") 

4002 else: 

4003 for stats, ci in zip(bxpstats, conf_intervals): 

4004 if ci is not None: 4004 ↛ 4003line 4004 didn't jump to line 4003, because the condition on line 4004 was never false

4005 if len(ci) != 2: 

4006 raise ValueError('each confidence interval must ' 

4007 'have two values') 

4008 else: 

4009 if ci[0] is not None: 4009 ↛ 4011line 4009 didn't jump to line 4011, because the condition on line 4009 was never false

4010 stats['cilo'] = ci[0] 

4011 if ci[1] is not None: 4011 ↛ 4003line 4011 didn't jump to line 4003, because the condition on line 4011 was never false

4012 stats['cihi'] = ci[1] 

4013 

4014 artists = self.bxp(bxpstats, positions=positions, widths=widths, 

4015 vert=vert, patch_artist=patch_artist, 

4016 shownotches=notch, showmeans=showmeans, 

4017 showcaps=showcaps, showbox=showbox, 

4018 boxprops=boxprops, flierprops=flierprops, 

4019 medianprops=medianprops, meanprops=meanprops, 

4020 meanline=meanline, showfliers=showfliers, 

4021 capprops=capprops, whiskerprops=whiskerprops, 

4022 manage_ticks=manage_ticks, zorder=zorder, 

4023 capwidths=capwidths) 

4024 return artists 

4025 

4026 def bxp(self, bxpstats, positions=None, widths=None, vert=True, 

4027 patch_artist=False, shownotches=False, showmeans=False, 

4028 showcaps=True, showbox=True, showfliers=True, 

4029 boxprops=None, whiskerprops=None, flierprops=None, 

4030 medianprops=None, capprops=None, meanprops=None, 

4031 meanline=False, manage_ticks=True, zorder=None, 

4032 capwidths=None): 

4033 """ 

4034 Drawing function for box and whisker plots. 

4035 

4036 Make a box and whisker plot for each column of *x* or each 

4037 vector in sequence *x*. The box extends from the lower to 

4038 upper quartile values of the data, with a line at the median. 

4039 The whiskers extend from the box to show the range of the 

4040 data. Flier points are those past the end of the whiskers. 

4041 

4042 Parameters 

4043 ---------- 

4044 bxpstats : list of dicts 

4045 A list of dictionaries containing stats for each boxplot. 

4046 Required keys are: 

4047 

4048 - ``med``: Median (scalar). 

4049 - ``q1``, ``q3``: First & third quartiles (scalars). 

4050 - ``whislo``, ``whishi``: Lower & upper whisker positions (scalars). 

4051 

4052 Optional keys are: 

4053 

4054 - ``mean``: Mean (scalar). Needed if ``showmeans=True``. 

4055 - ``fliers``: Data beyond the whiskers (array-like). 

4056 Needed if ``showfliers=True``. 

4057 - ``cilo``, ``cihi``: Lower & upper confidence intervals 

4058 about the median. Needed if ``shownotches=True``. 

4059 - ``label``: Name of the dataset (str). If available, 

4060 this will be used a tick label for the boxplot 

4061 

4062 positions : array-like, default: [1, 2, ..., n] 

4063 The positions of the boxes. The ticks and limits 

4064 are automatically set to match the positions. 

4065 

4066 widths : float or array-like, default: None 

4067 The widths of the boxes. The default is 

4068 ``clip(0.15*(distance between extreme positions), 0.15, 0.5)``. 

4069 

4070 capwidths : float or array-like, default: None 

4071 Either a scalar or a vector and sets the width of each cap. 

4072 The default is ``0.5*(with of the box)``, see *widths*. 

4073 

4074 vert : bool, default: True 

4075 If `True` (default), makes the boxes vertical. 

4076 If `False`, makes horizontal boxes. 

4077 

4078 patch_artist : bool, default: False 

4079 If `False` produces boxes with the `.Line2D` artist. 

4080 If `True` produces boxes with the `~matplotlib.patches.Patch` artist. 

4081 

4082 shownotches, showmeans, showcaps, showbox, showfliers : bool 

4083 Whether to draw the CI notches, the mean value (both default to 

4084 False), the caps, the box, and the fliers (all three default to 

4085 True). 

4086 

4087 boxprops, whiskerprops, capprops, flierprops, medianprops, meanprops :\ 

4088 dict, optional 

4089 Artist properties for the boxes, whiskers, caps, fliers, medians, and 

4090 means. 

4091 

4092 meanline : bool, default: False 

4093 If `True` (and *showmeans* is `True`), will try to render the mean 

4094 as a line spanning the full width of the box according to 

4095 *meanprops*. Not recommended if *shownotches* is also True. 

4096 Otherwise, means will be shown as points. 

4097 

4098 manage_ticks : bool, default: True 

4099 If True, the tick locations and labels will be adjusted to match the 

4100 boxplot positions. 

4101 

4102 zorder : float, default: ``Line2D.zorder = 2`` 

4103 The zorder of the resulting boxplot. 

4104 

4105 Returns 

4106 ------- 

4107 dict 

4108 A dictionary mapping each component of the boxplot to a list 

4109 of the `.Line2D` instances created. That dictionary has the 

4110 following keys (assuming vertical boxplots): 

4111 

4112 - ``boxes``: main bodies of the boxplot showing the quartiles, and 

4113 the median's confidence intervals if enabled. 

4114 - ``medians``: horizontal lines at the median of each box. 

4115 - ``whiskers``: vertical lines up to the last non-outlier data. 

4116 - ``caps``: horizontal lines at the ends of the whiskers. 

4117 - ``fliers``: points representing data beyond the whiskers (fliers). 

4118 - ``means``: points or lines representing the means. 

4119 

4120 Examples 

4121 -------- 

4122 .. plot:: gallery/statistics/bxp.py 

4123 """ 

4124 

4125 # lists of artists to be output 

4126 whiskers = [] 

4127 caps = [] 

4128 boxes = [] 

4129 medians = [] 

4130 means = [] 

4131 fliers = [] 

4132 

4133 # empty list of xticklabels 

4134 datalabels = [] 

4135 

4136 # Use default zorder if none specified 

4137 if zorder is None: 

4138 zorder = mlines.Line2D.zorder 

4139 

4140 zdelta = 0.1 

4141 

4142 def merge_kw_rc(subkey, explicit, zdelta=0, usemarker=True): 

4143 d = {k.split('.')[-1]: v for k, v in mpl.rcParams.items() 

4144 if k.startswith(f'boxplot.{subkey}props')} 

4145 d['zorder'] = zorder + zdelta 

4146 if not usemarker: 

4147 d['marker'] = '' 

4148 d.update(cbook.normalize_kwargs(explicit, mlines.Line2D)) 

4149 return d 

4150 

4151 box_kw = { 

4152 'linestyle': mpl.rcParams['boxplot.boxprops.linestyle'], 

4153 'linewidth': mpl.rcParams['boxplot.boxprops.linewidth'], 

4154 'edgecolor': mpl.rcParams['boxplot.boxprops.color'], 

4155 'facecolor': ('white' if mpl.rcParams['_internal.classic_mode'] 

4156 else mpl.rcParams['patch.facecolor']), 

4157 'zorder': zorder, 

4158 **cbook.normalize_kwargs(boxprops, mpatches.PathPatch) 

4159 } if patch_artist else merge_kw_rc('box', boxprops, usemarker=False) 

4160 whisker_kw = merge_kw_rc('whisker', whiskerprops, usemarker=False) 

4161 cap_kw = merge_kw_rc('cap', capprops, usemarker=False) 

4162 flier_kw = merge_kw_rc('flier', flierprops) 

4163 median_kw = merge_kw_rc('median', medianprops, zdelta, usemarker=False) 

4164 mean_kw = merge_kw_rc('mean', meanprops, zdelta) 

4165 removed_prop = 'marker' if meanline else 'linestyle' 

4166 # Only remove the property if it's not set explicitly as a parameter. 

4167 if meanprops is None or removed_prop not in meanprops: 

4168 mean_kw[removed_prop] = '' 

4169 

4170 # vertical or horizontal plot? 

4171 maybe_swap = slice(None) if vert else slice(None, None, -1) 

4172 

4173 def do_plot(xs, ys, **kwargs): 

4174 return self.plot(*[xs, ys][maybe_swap], **kwargs)[0] 

4175 

4176 def do_patch(xs, ys, **kwargs): 

4177 path = mpath.Path._create_closed( 

4178 np.column_stack([xs, ys][maybe_swap])) 

4179 patch = mpatches.PathPatch(path, **kwargs) 

4180 self.add_artist(patch) 

4181 return patch 

4182 

4183 # input validation 

4184 N = len(bxpstats) 

4185 datashape_message = ("List of boxplot statistics and `{0}` " 

4186 "values must have same the length") 

4187 # check position 

4188 if positions is None: 

4189 positions = list(range(1, N + 1)) 

4190 elif len(positions) != N: 

4191 raise ValueError(datashape_message.format("positions")) 

4192 

4193 positions = np.array(positions) 

4194 if len(positions) > 0 and not all(isinstance(p, Real) for p in positions): 4194 ↛ 4195line 4194 didn't jump to line 4195, because the condition on line 4194 was never true

4195 raise TypeError("positions should be an iterable of numbers") 

4196 

4197 # width 

4198 if widths is None: 

4199 widths = [np.clip(0.15 * np.ptp(positions), 0.15, 0.5)] * N 

4200 elif np.isscalar(widths): 

4201 widths = [widths] * N 

4202 elif len(widths) != N: 

4203 raise ValueError(datashape_message.format("widths")) 

4204 

4205 # capwidth 

4206 if capwidths is None: 

4207 capwidths = 0.5 * np.array(widths) 

4208 elif np.isscalar(capwidths): 

4209 capwidths = [capwidths] * N 

4210 elif len(capwidths) != N: 

4211 raise ValueError(datashape_message.format("capwidths")) 

4212 

4213 for pos, width, stats, capwidth in zip(positions, widths, bxpstats, 

4214 capwidths): 

4215 # try to find a new label 

4216 datalabels.append(stats.get('label', pos)) 

4217 

4218 # whisker coords 

4219 whis_x = [pos, pos] 

4220 whislo_y = [stats['q1'], stats['whislo']] 

4221 whishi_y = [stats['q3'], stats['whishi']] 

4222 # cap coords 

4223 cap_left = pos - capwidth * 0.5 

4224 cap_right = pos + capwidth * 0.5 

4225 cap_x = [cap_left, cap_right] 

4226 cap_lo = np.full(2, stats['whislo']) 

4227 cap_hi = np.full(2, stats['whishi']) 

4228 # box and median coords 

4229 box_left = pos - width * 0.5 

4230 box_right = pos + width * 0.5 

4231 med_y = [stats['med'], stats['med']] 

4232 # notched boxes 

4233 if shownotches: 

4234 notch_left = pos - width * 0.25 

4235 notch_right = pos + width * 0.25 

4236 box_x = [box_left, box_right, box_right, notch_right, 

4237 box_right, box_right, box_left, box_left, notch_left, 

4238 box_left, box_left] 

4239 box_y = [stats['q1'], stats['q1'], stats['cilo'], 

4240 stats['med'], stats['cihi'], stats['q3'], 

4241 stats['q3'], stats['cihi'], stats['med'], 

4242 stats['cilo'], stats['q1']] 

4243 med_x = [notch_left, notch_right] 

4244 # plain boxes 

4245 else: 

4246 box_x = [box_left, box_right, box_right, box_left, box_left] 

4247 box_y = [stats['q1'], stats['q1'], stats['q3'], stats['q3'], 

4248 stats['q1']] 

4249 med_x = [box_left, box_right] 

4250 

4251 # maybe draw the box 

4252 if showbox: 

4253 do_box = do_patch if patch_artist else do_plot 

4254 boxes.append(do_box(box_x, box_y, **box_kw)) 

4255 # draw the whiskers 

4256 whiskers.append(do_plot(whis_x, whislo_y, **whisker_kw)) 

4257 whiskers.append(do_plot(whis_x, whishi_y, **whisker_kw)) 

4258 # maybe draw the caps 

4259 if showcaps: 

4260 caps.append(do_plot(cap_x, cap_lo, **cap_kw)) 

4261 caps.append(do_plot(cap_x, cap_hi, **cap_kw)) 

4262 # draw the medians 

4263 medians.append(do_plot(med_x, med_y, **median_kw)) 

4264 # maybe draw the means 

4265 if showmeans: 

4266 if meanline: 

4267 means.append(do_plot( 

4268 [box_left, box_right], [stats['mean'], stats['mean']], 

4269 **mean_kw 

4270 )) 

4271 else: 

4272 means.append(do_plot([pos], [stats['mean']], **mean_kw)) 

4273 # maybe draw the fliers 

4274 if showfliers: 

4275 flier_x = np.full(len(stats['fliers']), pos, dtype=np.float64) 

4276 flier_y = stats['fliers'] 

4277 fliers.append(do_plot(flier_x, flier_y, **flier_kw)) 

4278 

4279 if manage_ticks: 

4280 axis_name = "x" if vert else "y" 

4281 interval = getattr(self.dataLim, f"interval{axis_name}") 

4282 axis = self._axis_map[axis_name] 

4283 positions = axis.convert_units(positions) 

4284 # The 0.5 additional padding ensures reasonable-looking boxes 

4285 # even when drawing a single box. We set the sticky edge to 

4286 # prevent margins expansion, in order to match old behavior (back 

4287 # when separate calls to boxplot() would completely reset the axis 

4288 # limits regardless of what was drawn before). The sticky edges
